questions.question_text: A company has been trying to implement a product with multiple challenges for more than two years. Both the company and the vendor mutually agree to cancel the project. Which of the following should be issued?

discussion.content:
D

It would be appropriate to issue a C&D (cancellation and dissolution) document in this situation where a company and the vendor mutually agree to cancel the project. The C&D document is an important project management document that officially terminates a project and outlines the terms of the termination.

Selected Answer: B
A Memorandum of Understanding is an agreement between two or more parties to form a
business partnership. It is not legally binding, but is more formal than a "gentlemen's agreement." It is used where the parties do not wish to enter into a formal contract, or when a legally enforceable contract cannot be created.

Similar to a memorandum of understanding, a letter of intent is a non-binding document that
outlines the agreement between parties before the official agreement documents are finalized and signed.

questions.question_text: A project manager notices a lack of meeting attendance from the project team. Which of the following actions might the project manager take to BEST improve the level of attendance?

discussion.content: In my opinion, the best answer is B.

comments.content:
A doesn't make any sense to me, especially for a large organization. You would have to individually add a calendar invite to every single attendees calendar, which could end up being 100 people or more. Then do that continually on a monthly or weekly basis. That would be incredibly inefficient. If we were taking this on from your perspective, I think the read receipts would make more sense from a personal accountability standpoint.

However, I still think it is B here. D would be my second guess.

An agenda makes for a more efficient and organized meeting but the question does not state the reason for poor attendance. In similar questions there is another qualifier that leads us to believe the meetings are chaotic, here there is no such mention. A is the best answer.

discussion.content: A B D are valid. A seems more direct though.

Selected Answer: B
B. Publish an agenda prior to the meeting would be the BEST action for the project manager to take to improve the level of attendance.

When team members are aware of what the meeting will cover, they can better prepare and understand the importance of their presence. By publishing an agenda prior to the meeting, the project manager can ensure that everyone is aware of the purpose of the meeting and what is expected of them. This will make team members more likely to prioritize attending the meeting and being present to discuss the important matters at hand.

choices.D: Send the meeting invitation by email with a read receipt.
choices.C: Increase the number of email invitations for the upcoming meeting.
choices.B: Publish an agenda prior to the meeting.
choices.A: Schedule the meeting directly on the attendees' calendars.

questions.question_text:
A contract manager is reconciling project invoices and needs to charge work performed by an outside contractor to a general ledger.
Which of the following would be the BEST project document to reference for this information?

discussion.content:

A cost management plan is a document that helps you map and control a budget. It enables project managers to estimate their costs, allocate resources to the right areas, and control overall spending. Cost management plans keep all project costs in one place, including direct and indirect costs.

Selected Answer: A
A. Task name, duration, and dependencies should be collected by the project manager at the end of the meeting when collecting work package information from the project team for the first time.

Task name, duration, and dependencies are essential elements of a work package. They are critical for understanding what work needs to be done, how long it will take, and what tasks must be completed before others can begin. Without this information, it would be difficult to manage the project timeline, assign resources, or identify potential roadblocks.

Selected Answer: D
During planning, project work is broken down into work packages and activities. Each work
package is assigned a budget and schedule. Because each increment of work is time-phased, a Schedule Variance (SV) results when work is not completed as scheduled. It is always better to understand the monetary value of work contribution as it relates to the schedule. Therefore, SV is often expressed in terms of the monetary value.
